xml.description:
Plot XY point

Plotting graphs is convenient for visualizing data. It is used heavily in mathematics and sciences. SEElab supports the following kinds of plots:



  • Ploting a variable as a function of time (obtained from the system)
  • Plotting individual (x,y) coordinates
  • Plotting data stored in lists.


This example demonstrates 'plotXY', that plots a single point.

We use a Count loop running from 0 to 360. Each iteration plots a point using the loop index as x coordinate and the sine of it as y coordinate.


Exercises


  • Add a small wait block inside the loop to observe the plot form gradually.
  • Change the frequency of the sine wave by inputting angle*frequency into the sine function.
  • Change the phase by adding a constant to angle before inputting
